page.title: 02ROWTON BROOK FARM, QUERNMORE
page.content: On the farm there are 1100 sheep and 160 cattle.The cattle are for beef and the sheep for wool and meat.There are 3 people working on the farm they are Mr. Longton, his son and his grandson. His farm is 730 acres mostly on fells and hillside.Rowton Brook flows through the land so that's where the farm gets its name from. Over the years farming has got easier for the Longtons.Some of the changes are they have more machinery to do more jobs,the fields are drained better than they used to be and the sheepdogs respond more quickly.Their sheep are fed more than they used to be which makes them bigger and stronger The sheep are dipped 3 times a year.It is compulsory for them to be dipped twice a year.
